We are researchers at UFAL (Federal University of Alagoas), UFPE (Federal University of Pernambuco), UFPA (Federal University of Pará), UFCG (Federal University of Campina Grande), and Puc-RIO (Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio de Janeiro) studying the information needs to identify bug-introducing changes. During the process of development and evolution of software, inevitably, developers perform changes, and these changes may introduce bugs, also known as bug-introducing changes.
The estimated time to complete the questionnaire is 20 minutes.
If you have any doubt, do not hesitate to contact us in jrmcs@ic.ufal.br (Jairo Souza).
ON THE BENEFITS TO DE RESPONDENTS
1. By filling this research instrument, you can participate in a Raffle of US$ 100 voucher at Amazon.com
2. The raffle will occur only if more than one third of the invited researchers fill this research instrument.
3. For each respondent of this research instrument, R$ 1 will be donated (limited to a maximum of R$ 200) to the Poorhouse (Casa do Pobre), which is a Brazilian NGO with more than 80 years of existence. More information about Poorhouse, you can find in its website http://casadopobre.blogspot.com/ (portuguese only).
STATEMENT OF INFORMED CONSENT
By filling this research instrument, you agree to permit the researcher to obtain, use and disclose the anonymous information provided as described below.
CONDITIONS AND STIPULATIONS
1. I understand that all information is confidential. I will not be personally identified. I agree to fill this research instrument for research purposes and that the data derived from this anonymous research instrument may be published in journals, conferences and blog posts.
2. I understand that my participation in this research instrument is totally voluntary, and that declining to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits. If I choose, I may withdraw my participation at any time. I also understand that if I choose to participate, that I may decline to answer any question that I am not comfortable answering.
3. I understand that I can contact the researcher if I have any questions about this research. I am aware that my consent will not directly benefit me. I am also aware that the author will maintain the data collected in perpetuity and may utilize data for future academic work.
